uk.ac.leeds.ccg.geotools
Class SimpleShader

java.lang.Object
  |
  +--uk.ac.leeds.ccg.geotools.SimpleShader
All Implemented Interfaces:
Shader
Direct Known Subclasses:
DiscreteShader, MonoShader, RampShader, RandomShader, UniqueShader
public abstract class SimpleShader
extends java.lang.Object
implements Shader

An abstract but almost full implementation of the Shader interface. This class is not much use as a shader, it is however very usefull as a class to extend other more complex shaders from as it can take care of the missingColor/Code aspects.

Method Detail

setMissingValueColor

public void setMissingValueColor(java.awt.Color color)
Set the color to use when the shader is passed a value equaling the missingValue code to the getColor method.

Quite often maps have features for which the value is missing, in such cases the shader may want to provide a special color to mark these features clearly.

Specified by:
setMissingValueColor in interface Shader
Parameters:
color - the color used to represent missing values.
See Also:
getColor, setMissingValueCode

setMissingValueCode

public void setMissingValueCode(double code)
Description copied from interface: Shader
Set the code that represents a missing value. Many data sets have missing values in them represented by a code, my using this method you can tell the shader what that value is. e.g. Arc/Info often uses -9999
Specified by:
setMissingValueCode in interface Shader
Following copied from interface: uk.ac.leeds.ccg.geotools.Shader
Parameters:
code - The double used to represent a missing value.
See Also:
Shader.setMissingValueColor(java.awt.Color)

getMissingValueCode

public double getMissingValueCode()
Description copied from interface: Shader
Gets the current code used to represent a missing value. Many data sets have missing values in them represented by a code, my using this method you can ask the shader what value it is currently using.

setRange

public void setRange(GeoData d)
Sets the range for this shader by checking the range of the given data set. this method also makes sure the GeoData's missing value code and the shaders missing value code match.
Specified by:
setRange in interface Shader
Parameters:
d - The GeoData to pull the range from
